data.title: Issue "set primary" for a building by using "deploy/return to base" hotkey
data.body: Seems reasonable, as even the cursor shape is the same for deploying and primary building selection.

data.title: Fix monster tanks not attacking radar domes
data.body: As bonus I also added the missing videos for mission completion/failure.

data.title: Load replays also in sub directories
data.body:
Requested here #13809

It is simpler to copy/delete a folder with replays, extract a zip,.. into e.g. \Documents\OpenRA\Replays\ra\release-20170527 than having to copy all replays into 1 folder.
If wanted/supported we might add a new filter option - folder selection to restrict the filter for select folder (e.g. a tournament, ...).

data.title: Stance selection on production buildings.
data.body: Brought up by Anjew in a thread to have production buildings such as barracks and war factories to set their stance of any type. This would allow newly created units to have their new default stance set to this.

data.title: Counterstrike and Aftermath The First Decade DVD with patch 1.02?
data.body:
Sorry I had posted on #13678 but I guess you didn't see it as the issue was closed.

The music files were included with the 1.02 patch. Anyway we can get it from there as part of an optional download?  Or if you must, only allow The first decade dvd users to be allowed to download it (not really sure if such a limitation is necessary).

data.title: Extract ViewportEdgeScrollMargin settings entry.
data.body: Closes #13702.

data.title: Revert "Have some activities count as idle activities"
data.body:
Fixes #13703.

Reopens #13015.

data.title: Add EnableDebugCommandsInReplays option
data.body:
Closes #13761

New option to enable chat also in Replays to use visual debug commands - Settings-Advanced:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16348750/29137843-f4a22dd4-7d41-11e7-9a79-ac65f11bedf0.png)

data.title: Focus the ViewportController on Standard/Inverted scroll modes.
data.body: Fixes #13727 and makes sure that scrolling remains active when the cursor moves over other interface elements (as it already does for Joystick scrolling).

data.title: Improve the description of LandOnCondition of Aircraft
data.body: This addresses the feedback from @pchote after https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13434 was merged.

data.title: Running replays directly from external web source
data.body:
> [18:34] <+pchote> the uri handlers already distinguish that
> [18:34] <+pchote> from the playtest on
> [18:35] <+pchote> for games they are e.g. openra-ra-playtest-20170722://127.0.0.1:1234
> [18:35] <+pchote> and for replays they could be openra-replay-ra-playtest-20170722://my.website/path/to.orarep

data.title: Option to change folders in replay browser
data.body:
Currently replay files are only found in Replays/ra/%version_name%/ folder. If there are folders inside, they are not parsed.
Would be much more convenient to allow folder changing.

Easier and less convenient feature to implement is to scan folders recursively from the main folder and display all games that were found.

data.title: Adjusted SAM Site missile launch offset
data.body: Closes #13788.

data.title: Keep Attack M./Guard while holding hotkey (revert Playtest change)
data.body:
Fixes #13804

It is basically like before but using command bar so there could be better solution, because like before, new GenericSelectTarget is being created constantly while holding A key.

data.title: Repair all buildings with a single key
data.body:
I would like to see a new feature where you can press one key to repair all buildings. If you have a ton of buildings, especially base defenses, it can be extremely difficult to click on all of them one by one. I have lost games because I couldn't click directly on the correct base defense in time.

It can be particularly troublesome to try and click on a base defense to repair it, and click repair on a unit by mistake and have them suddenly missing from combat as they return to the repair facility.

If you have the money, and wish to do so, why not press a button and have all buildings repair? Seems like something to make sense having in the game.

Thanks!

data.title: Helicopters cannot be repaired in C&C
data.body:
Running version release-20170527.

Reproduce by trying to send a helicopter to the repair facility in C&C. Cursor is a "move" cursor, not a "land" cursor. When sending the move order, the helicopter hovers above the repair facility.

Helipads do not repair helicopters either, though helicopters can land on them.

Expected behavior: when helicopter is selected and cursor is on repair facility, cursor changes to "land" and helicopter can be repaired. If multiple helicopters are selected and ordered to the repair facility, they get repaired one by one.

Thanks!

data.title: Multiple attack moves no longer issued when holding down 'A' [playtest 20170722] [bug]
data.body:
With offensive units selected, holding down the 'A' key and clicking multiple times results in a single attack move order, followed by multiple move orders. This is in playtest-20170722

Previously (confirmed by testing in release-20170527, and in previous releases from memory), each click would result in an attack move. This is how it should be.

Any idea why the behaviour changed? Can it be reverted please?

data.title: ReflectionTypeLoadException when starting game
data.body:
I get this exception now when trying to run with latest code from OpenRA.

Tried using mod ra and ts without any difference.

```
System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException occurred
  HResult=0x80131602
  Message=Unable to load one or more of the requested types. Retrieve the LoaderExceptions property for more information.
  Source=mscorlib
  StackTrace:
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeModule.GetTypes(RuntimeModule module)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeModule.GetTypes()
   at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes()
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args) in C:\Users\musku\Source\Repos\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 296
```

And with this value to the LoaderExceptions property:
```
-		LoaderExceptions	{System.Exception[2]}	System.Exception[]
+		[0]	{"Method 'Play2DStream' in type 'OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenAlSoundEngine' from assembly 'OpenRA.Platforms.Default, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' does not have an implementation.":"OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenAlSoundEngine"}	System.Exception {System.TypeLoadException}
+		[1]	{"Method 'get_Complete' in type 'OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenAlSound' from assembly 'OpenRA.Platforms.Default, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' does not have an implementation.":"OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenAlSound"}	System.Exception {System.TypeLoadException}
```

data.title: Add command bar to TS
data.body:
Using artwork by @x-a-n-a-x.

This is currently missing button states for hover and disabled, which we will need to fix before merging.

data.title: Implement instant refineries.
data.body:
AKA RA2 refinery logic.

Credit for this goes to @GraionDilach: https://github.com/AttacqueSuperior/Engine/commit/8cf23c4605e4532bfd7f2856ea366cadc5336658

data.title: Sound and/or map notification on enemy engineer capture start
data.body: Currently it's only a subject of map control and perception to not be a victim of base capturing from an enemy because when engineer triggers capturing it goes completely unnoticed (except losing your production tab access if it is the only production building type you have).

data.title: Range support for ExternalCaptures:
data.body: To implement something like Black Lotus's building hacking from Generals.

data.title: Rework the addition and removal of building influence
data.body: Pulled from #13796. This should improve performance a tiny bit as we don't do the extra trait query for `BuildingInfo` whenever an actor is added to or removed from the world.

data.title: Don't spawn new actors (using SpawnActorOnDeath) before all RemovedFromWorld callbacks have run
data.body:
Fixes #13694.

Testcase: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13694#issuecomment-317203713

data.title: Add TRUCK.Husk to Tiberian Dawn
data.body: Closes #13779. I wondered if we wanted to spawn a money crate instead though (as we do in RA).

data.title: Add the missing base implementation to AttackFrontal's RulesetLoaded
data.body: Closes  #13791.

data.title: Add missing wall tiles to the interior tileset
data.body: See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13035#issuecomment-290287558.

data.title: Move the interior tile 384 from the Floor to the Wall category
data.body: Fixes #13035. (See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13035#issuecomment-290316176.)

data.title: AttackFrontal overrides RulesetLoaded without calling the base implementation
data.body:
```
New defect(s) Reported-by: Coverity Scan
Showing 1 of 1 defect(s)


** CID 166174:  Class hierarchy inconsistencies  (CALL_SUPER)
/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Attack/AttackFrontal.cs: 23 in System.Void OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackFrontalInfo::RulesetLoaded(OpenRA.Ruleset,OpenRA.ActorInfo)()


________________________________________________________________________________________________________
*** CID 166174:  Class hierarchy inconsistencies  (CALL_SUPER)
/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Attack/AttackFrontal.cs: 23 in System.Void OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackFrontalInfo::RulesetLoaded(OpenRA.Ruleset,OpenRA.ActorInfo)()
17     {
18     	[Desc("Unit got to face the target")]
19     	public class AttackFrontalInfo : AttackBaseInfo, Requires<IFacingInfo>
20     	{
21     		public readonly int FacingTolerance = 0;
22     
   CID 166174:  Class hierarchy inconsistencies  (CALL_SUPER)
   Missing call to "OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ConditionalTraitInfo.RulesetLoaded(OpenRA.Ruleset, OpenRA.ActorInfo)" (as is done elsewhere 8 out of 9 times).
23     		public override void RulesetLoaded(Ruleset rules, ActorInfo ai)
24     		{
25     			if (FacingTolerance < 0 || FacingTolerance > 128)
26     				throw new YamlException("Facing tolerance must be in range of [0, 128], 128 covers 360 degrees.");
27     		}
```

Regression from #13530.
